47.1.hd_quote: The ability in times of hardship to concentrate on eradicating the negative factors that have led to oppression.
47.1.behavioral_axis: Looks back to identify what went wrong so realization can emerge.
47.1.shadow_axis: Projects blame outward and can’t stop reviewing the past.

47.2.hd_quote: The ambition and drive to overcome personal oppression in order to achieve security.
47.2.behavioral_axis: Stays active so the mind doesn’t sink into oppression.
47.2.shadow_axis: Gets busy with the wrong things and oppression returns.

47.3.hd_quote: The conscious and well integrated being whose natural right action will eventually come to see the unfoundedness of its oppression.
47.3.behavioral_axis: Learns that the mind’s oppression isn’t the present-moment reality.
47.3.shadow_axis: Loops in self-oppression and can’t accept ‘I’m actually okay today.’

47.4.behavioral_axis: Holds identity steady even when outer forces won’t resolve.
47.4.shadow_axis: Personalizes all external pressure and burns out.

47.5.hd_quote: The gift in times of oppression to maintain, without hypocrisy, a harmonic relationship with one's oppressors, while providing aid and succor to the oppressed.
47.5.behavioral_axis: Shows everyone oppression can be lived with grace and usefulness.
47.5.shadow_axis: Becomes over-available because ‘there is nothing else to do.’

47.6.hd_quote: Life as an ordeal stripped of realization.
47.6.behavioral_axis: Knows mental realization can’t fully end oppression; conserves resources.
47.6.shadow_axis: Depression, ‘why bother,’ rejects all attempts at meaning.
